Okay, I'm going to ask you a few questions. If the answer is indicitive of old age to a sufficient proportion, I reccomend you retire. 
 
 1.) Did you ever slay a dragon?
 2.) Was there a history class when you were in school?
 3.) What did you use to write in high school, and what did you write on?
 4.) Did you have to have an expert come in to program your sundial? 
 5.) Do you have at least a vague idea of what a computer is?
 6.) When you were in high school, what clothing was considered "fashionable" or "hot".
 7.) How did you feel when you witnessed the big bang?
 8.) What would happen to you if your grades weren't good in elementary school?
 9.) Did Barney the Dinosaur really exist?
 10.) Did Mr. Slate pay well?

post_info.post_title: Should you retire?  Find out right here!

I'm going to anwer my own questions.
 
 

 1.) Did you ever slay a dragon?

 
 Yeah, we did it all the time when I was younger.
 
 
2.) Was there a history class when you were in school?

 
 No.
 
 
3.) What did you use to write in high school, and what did you write on?

 
 When I was in school, we didn't have writing.
 
 
4.) Did you have to have an expert come in to program your sundial?

 
 Yeah. I'm not an expert on young people stuff.
 
 
5.) Do you have at least a vague idea of what a computer is?

 
 No. People tell me I use one when I post here, and I have no idea what they're talking about.
 
 
6.) When you were in high school, what clothing was considered "fashionable" or "hot"?

 
 We didn't have clothing at the time. Giggity giggity Goo!!
 
 
7.) How did you feel when you witnessed the big bang?

 
 I was happy to have some warmth.
 
 
8.) What would happen to you if your grades weren't good in elementary school?

 
 The Gods would punish me.
 
 
9.) Did Barney the Dinosaur really exist?

 
 He killed my brother! I try to hit him with my club, but the coward is safe hiding in his box.
 
 
10.) Did Mr. Slate pay well?

 
 You bet he did! I didn't care that union workers were hated, and Fred didn't seem to care either!
